intro: Commelina kotschyi, commonly known as the African morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers, which are typically borne in clusters on slender stems. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and have a waxy surface, while its roots are fibrous and often used in traditional medicine. Commelina kotschyi thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks.
